bioghist.p: Roderick L. Tondreau (1915-1999) received his M.D. from the University of Pennsylvania School of Medicine in 1940. Tondreau was the Director of Radiology at Holy Redeemer Hospital and a member of the Philadelphia Roentgen Ray Society.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of papers of Roderick L. Trondeau on the history of radiology. Materials include: photocopies of articles, curricula vitae, and biographical sketches from journals related to the history of radiology (some from the holdings of the library of the CPP); reprints and articles on roentgenology; a copy of Medical World New from 1965; program of the Roentgen Ray Society's 1976 meeting; a copy of "Radiologic Imaging in Philadelphia" by Tondreau and William Tuddenham; and a small amount of correspondence related to Tondreau's research on the history of radiology in Philadelphia.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
